section.title: Title
section.para: Make your title meaningful and short: include an action verb such as “install, configure, create…”.

section.title: What and why?

para.emphasis: Why do you need this feature?

section.para: Explain what the feature does and why is it useful to the user.

example.para: “In the Metadata group editor you can edit multiple object groups at the same time.”

section.title: How? (Task)

para.emphasis: How do I use this feature?

section.para: Create detailed and complete step-by-step instructions to perform the task. If you have more than 9 steps, divide the content into sub tasks.
Include background details such as prerequisites or recommendations if relevant.

example.para: Maybe the user must have certain admin rights to use the feature.

section.para: Include screenshots if they add value. Don’t include any confidential data in the screenshots.

section.title: Related information
section.para: Add links to any related topics.

example.para: If you’re writing about how to create a map in GIS, you could add a link to “Create a new legend set”.

section.title: Reference information
section.para: Examples of reference information are: language elements, class descriptions, commands, functions, and other API information.
